items.title: Tariffs, Trump, turmoil and typhoons: Global moments that defined 2025
items.summary: Here's a look at 2025, shaped by global events — from political shifts to natural disasters — defining a year of change and challenge.

items.title: How a Sydney hotel is helping a crucial support system under growing strain
items.summary: A century-old women's hostel has evolved, but it's continued its mission of supporting housing for women.

items.title: 'Not achieving the best we can': Why language learning is dwindling in Australia
items.summary: Learning a language can help with employability, but that focus is putting one of Australia’s most popular languages — and its connection to culture — at risk.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia announce 'immediate' ceasefire
items.summary: The ceasefire follows three days of border negotiations, announced after a crisis meeting of ASEAN foreign ministers.

items.title: Russia hits Ukraine with drone, missile strikes ahead of Zelenskyy-Trump meeting
items.summary: Before the overnight attacks, the Ukrainian president said the talks would focus on the territorial aspects of a proposed peace deal.

items.title: 'We have to do more': Wong apologises to Jewish community over Bondi terror attack
items.summary: The foreign minister said she would visit Bondi at an appropriate time, also conceding more had to be done to combat antisemitism.

items.title: Elusive wild cat thought to be extinct rediscovered in Thailand after 30 years
items.summary: Flat-headed cats are among the world's rarest and most threatened wild felines, with the last documented sighting in Thailand in 1995.

items.title: Two dead in alleged Palestinian ramming and knife attack in Israel
items.summary: It comes a day after an Israeli reservist allegedly rammed his vehicle into a Palestinian man as he prayed on a roadside in the occupied West Bank.

items.title: Why the US struck IS targets in Nigeria, and why an expert says Trump is 'oversimplifying' it
items.summary: Announcing the strikes, Trump claimed terrorists had been targeting Christians "at levels not seen for many years" in Nigeria.

items.title: Shooting victims honoured as Sydney to Hobart crews pass Bondi Beach
items.summary: Olympic swimming great Ian Thorpe was among those in the 129-strong fleet to pay tribute.

items.title: Have an hour to spare these holidays? It could make a big difference to your retirement
items.summary: Many Australians don’t know their super balance or how it’s invested — and the super industry says the holidays are a good time to change that.

items.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 years over 1MDB scandal
items.summary: Najib has been found guilty of money laundering and abuse of power in the biggest trial yet in the 1MDB scandal.

items.title: Another election, 'no winner'? What’s at stake in Kosovo's snap vote
items.summary: The Balkan country is headed to the polls on Sunday, after nearly a year of political deadlock that's caused "colossal damage" to its economy.

items.title: Ready for take-off? Here's how international travel is changing in 2026
items.summary: From fresh international routes to new digital identity requirements, here's what you need to know about heading overseas next year.

items.title: Boxing Day sales: How to get the best bang for your buck — and the scams to watch out for
items.summary: Australians are expected to spend more on Boxing Day sales this year. Here's how to take

items.title: Victoria Police name person of interest in Hanukkah car fire
items.summary: Victoria Police is searching for a person of interest as part of its early investigation into a suspected arson attack in south-east Melbourne.

items.title: Burnt out from 2025? Here's how to actually rest over the break
items.summary: December can be a stressful time of year, and not everyone returns to work refreshed after the festive season.

items.title: Streaming surge reveals how Australia's internet usage is changing
items.summary: New NBN data reveals how streaming, working from home and faster broadband are reshaping Australia's internet usage.

items.title: Türkiye arrests more than 100 suspected IS members over alleged terror plots, officials say
items.summary: The group was allegedly planning attacks during Christmas and New Year's celebrations, particularly against non-Muslims.

items.title: 'Shared longing for peace': King Charles praises Bondi heroes in Christmas message
items.summary: King Charles has spoken about overcoming uncertainty and division in his annual Christmas address.

items.title: Pope Leo decries conditions for Palestinians in Gaza in first Christmas sermon
items.summary: In an address from the balcony of St Peter's Basilica, the pontiff also called for an end to conflicts in Ukraine, Sudan, Thailand and Cambodia.

items.title: NSW Police invoke new powers to restrict Sydney protests for two weeks
items.summary: NSW Police have imposed temporary limits on public gatherings under emergency laws passed in response to the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Why Christmas can be lonely — and how charities are working to change that
items.summary: Christmas can be a challenging time for some. These groups are working to bring community to those who need it.

items.title: Desi carols, card games and carp: Some Christmas customs you might've never heard about
items.summary: Around the world, and in migrant communities across Australia, a diverse range of customs give Christmas a unique flavour.
